intro: Munnozia sagasteguii, commonly known as the Sierra Valley mule's ear, is a flowering plant native to California and northern Baja California. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in open woodland and chaparral habitats. It produces small, dark blue to purple berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Munnozia sagasteguii is adapted to dry, Mediterranean climates and is often found in areas with full sun exposure.
